title: The Time Meddler
dialogue_triumphs: Steven, pointing to a switch on the console: 'Well, what does this do?' Doctor: 'That is the dematerialising control. And that over yonder is the horizontal hold. Up there is the scanner, those are the doors, that is a chair with a panda on it. Sheer poetry, dear boy. Now please stop bothering me.'
The Doctor finds a Viking helmet, but Steven still doesn't believe that they have time-travelled. 'What do you think it is, a space helmet for a cow?' responds the Doctor.
goofs: In episode one Steven, on finding a wrist watch, asks how they could possibly be in the 10th century (the Doctor has already told him they are in the 11th).
Hartnell stumbles the response: 'But I'm not a mountain goat and I prefer walking to any day. And I hate climbing.'
Hartnell also has a problem with 'personal correspondence' in the final episode.

continuity_notes.name: TARDIS
continuity_notes.description: The Doctor's time machine, with a faulty chameleon circuit and random landings.

continuity_notes.name: The Doctor
continuity_notes.description: Time Lord protagonist, left his home planet 50 years before the Monk
continuity_notes.current_status: Traveling with companions, concerned about time meddling

continuity_notes.name: The Monk
continuity_notes.description: Another Time Lord, uses time travel for personal gain and to alter history

continuity_notes.name: Mark Four TARDIS
continuity_notes.description: The Monk's more advanced TARDIS with better controls and features
continuity_notes.current_status: Functional until sabotaged by the Doctor

roots: A Connecticut Yankee in King Arthur's Court
links: Vicki notes that she would quite like to take a proper look at New York ('The Chase').

locations.name: Northumbria
locations.current_status: Setting of the story in late Summer, 1066

untold_adventures: The Monk meeting Leonardo Da Vinci and discussing principles of powered flight
The Monk helping ancient Britons build Stonehenge using an anti-gravity lift
additional_notes: This story marks a significant change in Doctor Who, introducing another Time Lord and the concept of altering history through time travel interference.
bottom_line: An atmospheric story with cheesy Saxons and Vikings, but significant for introducing another Time Lord and the concept of changing history. Good performances, especially from Hartnell and Butterworth, with a lovely season end.
